title: Canine
data:
The **canine**, usually short for **dog or other canine**, is a [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, and is represented by the lowercase [d](/wiki/D "D") glyph (d). Dogs and canines are designated internally by the macro `S_DOG`.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

The class contains the following monsters:[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

- d [jackal](/wiki/Jackal "Jackal")
- d [fox](/wiki/Fox "Fox")
- d [coyote](/wiki/Coyote "Coyote")
- d [werejackal (animal)](/wiki/Werejackal_\(animal\) "Werejackal (animal)")
- d [little dog](/wiki/Little_dog "Little dog")
- d [dingo](/wiki/Dingo "Dingo")
- d [dog](/wiki/Dog "Dog")
- d [large dog](/wiki/Large_dog "Large dog")
- d [wolf](/wiki/Wolf "Wolf")
- d [werewolf (animal)](/wiki/Werewolf_\(animal\) "Werewolf (animal)")
- d [winter wolf cub](/wiki/Winter_wolf_cub "Winter wolf cub")
- d [warg](/wiki/Warg "Warg")
- d [winter wolf](/wiki/Winter_wolf "Winter wolf")
- d [hell hound pup](/wiki/Hell_hound_pup "Hell hound pup")
- d [hell hound](/wiki/Hell_hound "Hell hound")
- [Deferred](/wiki/Deferred "Deferred") monsters
  - d [Cerberus](/wiki/Cerberus "Cerberus")

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Common traits](#Common_traits)
  - [1.1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Messages](#Messages)

- [3 Variants](#Variants)

  - [3.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [3.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [3.3 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [3.4 notdNetHack](#notdNetHack)
  - [3.5 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [3.6 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [3.7 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [4 References](#References)

## Common traits

Canines are quadrupedal and [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") [animals](/wiki/Animal "Animal"); they lack [hands](/wiki/Hands "Hands"), and are visible via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). Canines can be separated into four broad categories:

- [Domestic](/wiki/Domestic "Domestic") dogs: the little dog, dog and large dog
- [Werecreatures](/wiki/Werecreature "Werecreature"): the animal forms of the werewolf and werejackal
- 'Ordinary' canines: jackals, foxes, coyotes, dingoes, and wolves
- Fantastic canines: wargs, winter wolves and their cubs, hell hounds and their pups, and Cerberus

Canines primarily attack via bites, and the fantastic canines except for the warg also have a [breath](/wiki/Breath "Breath") weapon.

Canines are either of [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral") [alignment](/wiki/Alignment "Alignment") as with the warg and mundane canine monsters, or they are [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic") as with the canine [werecreatures](/wiki/Werecreature "Werecreature") and the other fantastic canines. [Chatting](/wiki/Chatting "Chatting") to a tame canine monster can be used [to gauge its current condition](#Messages).

Canines that eat [mimic](/wiki/Mimic "Mimic") corpses may assume the form of a [sink](/wiki/Sink "Sink") or [tripe ration](/wiki/Tripe_ration "Tripe ration") for the duration of the meal if they do not assume a monster-specific form.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) Monsters that [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into any canine monster - excluding werecreatures assuming their animal form - will produce a specific message if this occurs out of the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero")'s sight.[\[5\]](#cite_note-smell-5)

### Generation

Randomly generated canines that are not domestic are always created hostile; domestic canines are sometimes peaceful towards neutral characters.

The canine is the first [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") for [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai"), and makes up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Samurai quest](/wiki/Samurai_quest "Samurai quest"). Some random canines are also generated on a few levels within the quest branch at level creation: one each is placed randomly on every floor between the home and goal levels, and two are randomly placed on the goal level itself.

## Messages

- \<The canine> howls.

  You chatted to a canine while it is night [time](/wiki/Time "Time") during a full [moon](/wiki/Moon "Moon"), regardless of other circumstances.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

- \<The canine> whines.

  Your tame canine is hungry, caught in a [trap](/wiki/Trap "Trap"), [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused"), [scared](/wiki/Scared "Scared"), or at low tameness.[\[7\]](#cite_note-7) A leashed canine that is near a square with a trap will whine on its own.[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)

- \<The canine> barks.

  A tame non-dingo canine will become hungry in 1000 turns or less, or you chatted to a peaceful non-dingo canine.[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)

- \<The canine> yips.

  You chatted to a peaceful or tame canine, and none of the above conditions apply.[\[10\]](#cite_note-10)

- \<The canine> growls.

  You chatted to a hostile canine.[\[11\]](#cite_note-11)

* You notice a dog smell.

  A monster polymorphed into a dog outside of your sight range.[\[5\]](#cite_note-smell-5)

## Variants

Some variants enable the deferred Cerberus so that he can appear in normal gameplay.

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") adds several new canines to the monster class:

- d [pit bull](/wiki/Pit_bull "Pit bull")
- d [dingo puppy](/wiki/Dingo_puppy "Dingo puppy")
- d [large dingo](/wiki/Large_dingo "Large dingo")
- d [death dog](/wiki/Death_dog "Death dog")
- d [rabid wolf](/wiki/Rabid_wolf "Rabid wolf")
- d [wolverine](/wiki/Wolverine "Wolverine")
- d [shadow wolf](/wiki/Shadow_wolf "Shadow wolf")
- d [mist wolf](/wiki/Mist_wolf "Mist wolf")
- d [Cerberus](/wiki/Cerberus_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Cerberus (SLASH'EM)")

The canine is the second quest monster class for [Yeomen](/wiki/Yeomen "Yeomen"), and makes up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Yeoman quest](/wiki/Yeoman_quest "Yeoman quest").

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") adds a few new canines to the monster class:

- d [Cerberus](/wiki/Cerberus_\(dNetHack\) "Cerberus (dNetHack)")
- d [hound of Tindalos](/wiki/Hound_of_Tindalos "Hound of Tindalos")
- d [anuban jackal](/wiki/Anuban_jackal "Anuban jackal")
- d [seal](/wiki/Seal "Seal")
- d [Watchdog of the Boreal Valley](/index.php?title=Watchdog_of_the_Boreal_Valley\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Watchdog of the Boreal Valley (page does not exist)")

### SpliceHack

[SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") adds several new canines to the monster class:

- d [winter wolf pup](/index.php?title=Winter_wolf_pup\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Winter wolf pup (page does not exist)")
- d [thought eater](/index.php?title=Thought_eater\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Thought eater (page does not exist)")
- d [guard dog](/wiki/Guard_dog "Guard dog")
- d [vulpferno](/index.php?title=Vulpferno\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Vulpferno (page does not exist)")
- d [pack lord](/index.php?title=Pack_lord\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Pack lord (page does not exist)")

### notdNetHack

[notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack") retain the monsters added in dNetHack and add another canine to the monster class:

- d [Naberius](/wiki/Naberius "Naberius")

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") adds several new canines to the monster class:

- d [rabid dog](/wiki/Rabid_dog "Rabid dog")
- d [weredemon](/wiki/Weredemon "Weredemon")
- d [Koa](/wiki/Koa "Koa")
- d [Bourbon](/wiki/Bourbon "Bourbon")
- d [Ozzy](/wiki/Ozzy "Ozzy")
- d [Cerberus](/wiki/Cerberus_\(EvilHack\) "Cerberus (EvilHack)")

The canine is the first quest monster class for [Infidels](/wiki/Infidel "Infidel"), and makes up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Infidel quest](/wiki/Infidel_quest "Infidel quest").

### SlashTHEM

[SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") retains the monsters added in SLASH'EM and adds several new canines to the monster class:

- d [shock hound pup](/wiki/Shock_hound_pup "Shock hound pup")
- d [acid hound pup](/index.php?title=Acid_hound_pup\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Acid hound pup (page does not exist)")
- d [shock hound](/wiki/Shock_hound "Shock hound")
- d [acid hound](/wiki/Acid_hound "Acid hound")
- d [Cerberus](/wiki/Cerberus_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Cerberus (SLASH'EM)")

### Hack'EM

[Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") adds many new canines to the monster class from other variants:

- d [dingo puppy](/wiki/Dingo_puppy "Dingo puppy")
- d [rabid dog](/wiki/Rabid_dog "Rabid dog")
- d [death dog](/wiki/Death_dog "Death dog")
- d [rabid wolf](/wiki/Rabid_wolf "Rabid wolf")
- d [large dingo](/wiki/Large_dingo "Large dingo")
- d [guard dog](/wiki/Guard_dog "Guard dog")
- d [pit bull](/wiki/Pit_bull "Pit bull")
- d [barghest](/wiki/Barghest "Barghest")
- d [wolverine](/wiki/Wolverine "Wolverine")
- d [shadow wolf](/wiki/Shadow_wolf "Shadow wolf")
- d [mist wolf](/wiki/Mist_wolf "Mist wolf")
- d [weredemon](/wiki/Weredemon "Weredemon")
- d [nova fox](/wiki/Nova_fox "Nova fox")
- d [Cerberus](/wiki/Cerberus_\(EvilHack\) "Cerberus (EvilHack)")

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 18](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/include/monsym.h#L18)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 196](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/monst.c#L196)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/dogmove.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1352](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/dogmove.c#L1352)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/dogmove.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1354](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/dogmove.c#L1354)
5. ↑ [5.0](#cite_ref-smell_5-0) [5.1](#cite_ref-smell_5-1) [src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 4225](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mon.c#L4225)
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [src/sounds.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 637](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/sounds.c#L637)
7. [↑](#cite_ref-7) [src/sounds.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 643](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/sounds.c#L643)
8. [↑](#cite_ref-8) [src/sounds.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 437](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/sounds.c#L437)

html:
Canine

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The canine, usually short for dog or other canine, is a monster class that appears in NetHack, and is represented by the lowercase d glyph (d). Dogs and canines are designated internally by the macro S_DOG.[1]

The class contains the following monsters:[2]

  • d jackal
  • d fox
  • d coyote
  • d werejackal (animal)
  • d little dog
  • d dingo
  • d dog
  • d large dog
  • d wolf
  • d werewolf (animal)
  • d winter wolf cub
  • d warg
  • d winter wolf
  • d hell hound pup
  • d hell hound
  • Deferred monsters
    • d Cerberus

Contents

  • 1 Common traits
    • 1.1 Generation
  • 2 Messages
  • 3 Variants
    • 3.1 SLASH'EM
    • 3.2 dNetHack
    • 3.3 SpliceHack
    • 3.4 notdNetHack
    • 3.5 EvilHack
    • 3.6 SlashTHEM
    • 3.7 Hack'EM
  • 4 References

Common traits

Canines are quadrupedal and carnivorous animals; they lack hands, and are visible via infravision. Canines can be separated into four broad categories:

  • Domestic dogs: the little dog, dog and large dog
  • Werecreatures: the animal forms of the werewolf and werejackal
  • 'Ordinary' canines: jackals, foxes, coyotes, dingoes, and wolves
  • Fantastic canines: wargs, winter wolves and their cubs, hell hounds and their pups, and Cerberus

Canines primarily attack via bites, and the fantastic canines except for the warg also have a breath weapon.

Canines are either of neutral alignment as with the warg and mundane canine monsters, or they are chaotic as with the canine werecreatures and the other fantastic canines. Chatting to a tame canine monster can be used to gauge its current condition.

Canines that eat mimic corpses may assume the form of a sink or tripe ration for the duration of the meal if they do not assume a monster-specific form.[3][4] Monsters that polymorph into any canine monster - excluding werecreatures assuming their animal form - will produce a specific message if this occurs out of the hero's sight.[5]

Generation

Randomly generated canines that are not domestic are always created hostile; domestic canines are sometimes peaceful towards neutral characters.

The canine is the first quest monster class for Samurai, and makes up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Samurai quest. Some random canines are also generated on a few levels within the quest branch at level creation: one each is placed randomly on every floor between the home and goal levels, and two are randomly placed on the goal level itself.

Messages

<The canine> howls.
You chatted to a canine while it is night time during a full moon, regardless of other circumstances.[6]
<The canine> whines.
Your tame canine is hungry, caught in a trap, confused, scared, or at low tameness.[7] A leashed canine that is near a square with a trap will whine on its own.[8]
<The canine> barks.
A tame non-dingo canine will become hungry in 1000 turns or less, or you chatted to a peaceful non-dingo canine.[9]
<The canine> yips.
You chatted to a peaceful or tame canine, and none of the above conditions apply.[10]
<The canine> growls.
You chatted to a hostile canine.[11]
You notice a dog smell.
A monster polymorphed into a dog outside of your sight range.[5]

Variants

Some variants enable the deferred Cerberus so that he can appear in normal gameplay.

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM adds several new canines to the monster class:

  • d pit bull
  • d dingo puppy
  • d large dingo
  • d death dog
  • d rabid wolf
  • d wolverine
  • d shadow wolf
  • d mist wolf
  • d Cerberus

The canine is the second quest monster class for Yeomen, and makes up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Yeoman quest.

dNetHack

dNetHack adds a few new canines to the monster class:

  • d Cerberus
  • d hound of Tindalos
  • d anuban jackal
  • d seal
  • d Watchdog of the Boreal Valley

SpliceHack

SpliceHack adds several new canines to the monster class:

  • d winter wolf pup
  • d thought eater
  • d guard dog
  • d vulpferno
  • d pack lord

notdNetHack

notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack retain the monsters added in dNetHack and add another canine to the monster class:

  • d Naberius

EvilHack

EvilHack adds several new canines to the monster class:

  • d rabid dog
  • d weredemon
  • d Koa
  • d Bourbon
  • d Ozzy
  • d Cerberus

The canine is the first quest monster class for Infidels, and makes up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Infidel quest.

SlashTHEM

SlashTHEM retains the monsters added in SLASH'EM and adds several new canines to the monster class:

  • d shock hound pup
  • d acid hound pup
  • d shock hound
  • d acid hound
  • d Cerberus

Hack'EM

Hack'EM adds many new canines to the monster class from other variants:

  • d dingo puppy
  • d rabid dog
  • d death dog
  • d rabid wolf
  • d large dingo
  • d guard dog
  • d pit bull
  • d barghest
  • d wolverine
  • d shadow wolf
  • d mist wolf
  • d weredemon
  • d nova fox
  • d Cerberus
